intro: Homalium rubriflorum, commonly known as the red-flowered huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, showy red flowers that appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
